page.title: 03FARMING PRACTICE
page.content:
Farming Practice.
There are three working farms in the area, covering 90% of the land. Crops are generally rotated with wheat, barley, and sown grass for grazing. All have store cattle and Myrtlegrove Farm has a dairy herd. Muntham Farm has 50 acres of woodland and there is pheasant rearing over the whole area. On this downland there is a very thin layer of soil over the chalk, so soil conservation and testing is an important item of management. Field names reflect the history of the residents and social life of the area, some of the more interesting being Back of Cobden, Cockhill, Giants Cave, Tolmare, Ramsdean, Keepers, Greenwicks. The Gibbet was used for foxes and other vermin, not humans.
